body.p: I received a letter from yoyou this morninmorning dated the 13 and was very glad to hear from yoyou iI am not very well iI have good deledeal of pain in my hip and head iI see by the tones of yiouryour letter that yoyou are not very well iI hope by the time this letter reaches yoyou they may find yoyou well iI know it is bad to loos a brother but the lord giveth and the lord taketh away an then we must all sooner or later give up this world— iI had a few lines from home this morning my little girl is sick and iI feeling bad to think that iI cantcan't see her now but my prays is that she may better soon well father iI am going to my ridgementregiment iI think the doctor marked so but iI cantcan't march we expect evryevery day to start for elickazandryAlexandria [Alexandria] to the convalesentconvalescent camp if iI could get to the city iI could get my discharge but iI cantcan't father iI thank yoyou for seeing about my discriptavedescriptive list for they owe me now six months pay and iI want iI very bad they paid all those that had thairtheir discriptavedescriptive lists the doctors here are meenmen for they have no feeing to a man father the wetherwhether is getting cold here now and iI will be glad wen iI get away from here iI long to see yoyou and have a good talk with yoyou for yoyou have benbeen kind to me wen iI Could not help my self and iI hope the day may come wen iI can do for yoyou some good in return for father you dontedon't know how iI do love you iI dontedon't know wywhy it is iI am more attached yoyou than ennyany one that iI was acquainted with the papers gives us good news now conserningconcerning the war iI hope theatthat peace may soonesoon be proclaimed thairtheir has been a grate many lives lost in the cruel war father iI wish that yoyou would send yiour likenes and iI will send yoyou mine & iI wish that iI could see yoyou iI hope that iI may soon see yoyou their is about 15 rebs here now they get all they want and the doctersdoctors pays thairtheir attention to the will the rebs over our men like dogs now strange it is well it may be all for the best iI hope they will turn thairtheir corsecourse before it is to late
Dear father and ComradComrade iI will close now good by and may god take care of yoyou and that we may soon meet from friend & son William Vandemark to his comradcomrade and father and friend
